content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 06 Apr 2019Investment strategy for a NSF?I'm currently in my second year of NS, earning slightly under $1k/month.. Should I be investing in the STI ETF or should I save up for REITS and other shares for a dividend investment approach?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Luke Ho, Money Maverick at Money MaverickLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Either is fine. I've been very vocal about my dislike for the STI ETF in particular, but you're not going to be an NSF forever. And assuming you don't intend to use your investments to pay for uni fees, at least it will roll for a couple of years until you have a job. Good for you. When you have a job, look for something that yields higher or has better dividends, which I can offer you easily.  https://www.facebook.com/luke.ho.542 comments0

Benjamin Seah06 Apr 2019How would you recommend to spread out my investments considering that I have a pretty low income?Luke Ho08 Apr 2019Focus on the STI first, since there's an easier point of entry.
